description: Temporary change of use of Glaxo House (for a period of three years ) into flexible Use Classes A1 (shops), A3 (cafes and restaurants), A4 (Drinking Establishments), B1(a) (Offices), B1(c) (Light Industrial), D1 (art galleries and museums), D2 (assembly and leisure), and theatre use (Sui Generis) with associated landscaping, cycle parking and access.
decision_conditions: This temporary permission shall be for a limited period of 36 months from the date of this permission when the uses (subject to this consent) shall be discontinued.
REASON: To ensure that the use is temporary in nature in accordance with the permission given.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings referenced as:
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_0100 - Location Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0001 - Existing Lower Ground Floor Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0002 - Existing Ground Floor Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0003 - Existing First Floor Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0004 - Existing North/East Elevations
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0005 - Existing South/West Elevations
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0006 - Existing Block 1 Sections
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_0200 - Proposed Lower Ground Floor Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0201 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0202 - Proposed First Floor Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0203 - Proposed Section A-A
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0204 - Proposed Section B-B
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0205 - Proposed Section C-C
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0206 - Proposed West/South Elevations
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_B1_DR_0207 - Proposed Entrance Elevation
GRS-GSK_HTA-A_0101 - Phasing/Access Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-L_01_DR_0900 - Landscape Plan
GRS-GSK_HTA-L_01_DR_0901 - Detailed Landscape Plan
Meanwhile Use Acoustic Assessment RBA Acoustics Ref 9630/AAR dated 29/08/2019
Heritage Statement, Heritage Collective (undated)
REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The meanwhile use of the premises shall not commence unless details have been submitted to the Council and been approved in writing.  Details shall confirm that the composite sound reduction index of the building, Rw, will achieve the following criteria, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided. The existing lowest background L90, 15min linear noise levels in any one third octave band 50Hz- 160Hz and also the overall linear L90 levels, as measured at 1m metre from the nearest and/or most affected facades of noise sensitive premises, shall not be increased during the playing of amplified or unamplified sounds at the development, as measured in the same positions, using L90 linear over 5 minute periods.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| The use shall not commence until all external doors to the premises have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time during the emission of noise shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise /odour /smoke /fumes, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| Where amplified sounds or loud crowd noise is to be emitted, details shall be submitted to Council for approval in writing, of the installation of acoustic lobbies to entrances and exits which would otherwise allow the emission of internal noise to neighbouring noise sensitive premises.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| Prior to the playing of loud amplified sounds within certain units of the building, suitable sound limiting device(s) shall be installed and used during the playing of any amplified sounds, with individual controls for bass frequencies and for higher frequencies. The maximum internal sound levels shall be set at 86dBA Leq, daytime and 82dBA Leq, night time, or lower. Additional measures should be taken to ensure that instrumental music and amplified sounds are contained within their source rooms.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| Noise mitigation measures shall be installed in the separating structures between the walls separating units where amplified sounds, instrumental music or mechanical/machine noise are emitted, from noise sensitive uses within the building. The sound insulation value shall be enhanced by at least 10dB-15dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures shall be implemented  to contain amplified sounds within the source rooms. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. All mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be retained throughout its use.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| The 'meanwhile uses' hereby permitted shall not operate outside the hours of 07:00 to 22:00 Monday to Saturday, and 0800 - 2100 hrs on Sundays and Bank or Public Holidays unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 policy 3.5 of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| Based on measures identified in the approved Remediation Method Statement (submitted under 164694), and before occupation of the site, a verification report that demonstrates that the meadow area and any other soft landscape areas are suitable for the proposed use for the 3 year temporary period must be submitted for the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation / use of this part of the wider site.  The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the latest Environment Agency guidance and industry best practice.

Reason: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
